channel.title: Lets try again... Importing PHP files into another PHP file
channel.description: Ok, so I want to import a PHP file into another one. In other words, I want the stuff on the PHP file that is being imported to be displayed in the other PHP file. The php file thats being imported is [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,362433.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,362433.0.html[/url] and the PHP file its being imported into is home.php. Help me please!

item.title: Lets try again... Importing PHP files into another PHP file
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:


For the PHP import, by placing the @ symbol before require_once suppresses any error messages that might be generated in the included PHP file.

For the PHP import, by placing the @ symbol before require_once suppresses any error messages that might be generated in the included PHP file.

Read full topic
item.source: Lets try again... Importing PHP files into another PHP file
